SENTENCE.STRING: (Fijian: Viti]; Hindustānī: फ़िजी فِجی), officially the Republic of the Fiji Islands, is an island nation in the South Pacific Ocean, east of Vanuatu, west of Tonga and south of Tuvalu.
occupies an archipelago of about 322 islands, of which 106 are permanently inhabited; in addition, there are some 522 islets.
The two major islands, Viti Levu and Vanua Levu, account for some 87% of the total population.
The name Fiji is the old Tongan word for the islands, which is in turn derived from the Fijian name Viti.
